data.text:
@FrancaRose33 "Not true"? I merely that it fits the figures (in the UK). There are a lot of unvaccinated people in the ethnic population of London (up to 40%), yet they weren't dropping like flies from Omicron. They were on previous variants.

We don't have breakdown of deaths by variant.
@extremecompute On the excess death chart, look at the last spike compared to Jan 2021. Not as bad but close.
@extremecompute What? That’s not true. We had a major death spike this winter, all omicron, mostly unvaxxed and unboosted. Esp significant when you look by age group.

@FrancaRose33 Data from the last couple of months suggests this isn't true for Omicron. In fact it's pointing to existing C19 vaccines having little effect; but that's okay as Omicron is rarely serious.
It's previous and possible future strains the needle-dodgers need to worry about.
@extremecompute That’s not a slight difference! And vaxx makes enormous difference in severity of disease.

@FrancaRose33 I wish I was surprised :-(

I don't see slight differences in vaccination rates making much difference at this stage. Everyone's getting immunity through Omicron instead.

@extremecompute Maybe your booster rates are higher than ours?

I read the craziest article on Hong Kong… they have spiking deaths now because only 50% over 50 and 25% over 70 are vaccinated!! That is INSANE. They really thought they would never be exposed.

@FrancaRose33 So have we, pretty much, with huge spikes in Apr 20 and Jan 21. Since Omicron took hold, however, it's actually fallen well below average.
Omicron isn't benign, but neither is it deadly based on the figures I'm looking at (and I'm not the "selective reading" type!)
@extremecompute Will be interesting to see how that shakes out. We’ve been consistently higher than normal since March 2020.
